body_html: I tried to create the wheels for Ubuntu, and wanted to follow up. For our purposes, we do not need a manylinux wheel that works across multiple linux distros (which is otherwise useful, and for uploading to pypi). I was able to easily create one ~ 45 MB for linux_x86_64 which is what we need for CI testing on ubuntu machines. I am now trying to figure out where to host it with public read permissions so that CI machines have access to this, and do not need to build PyTorch from source. I wanted to check if you have nightly/weekly PyTorch builds available that we could download for CI testing, instead? cc. @ezyang.

body: I tried to create the wheels for Ubuntu, and wanted to follow up. For our purposes, we do not need a manylinux wheel that works across multiple linux distros (which is otherwise useful, and for uploading to pypi). I was able to easily create one ~ 45 MB for `linux_x86_64` which is what we need for CI testing on ubuntu machines. I am now trying to figure out where to host it with public read permissions so that CI machines have access to this, and do not need to build PyTorch from source. I wanted to check if you have nightly/weekly PyTorch builds available that we could download for CI testing, instead?  cc. @ezyang.
